If $\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\cap E)\leq\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\backslash E)$ ,then 
$$
\begin{array}{r l r}{\lefteqn{\left(\int_{B_{R}}|u-u_{B_{R}}|^{1*}d x\right)^{1/1^{*}}\geq\frac{\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\setminus E)}{\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R})}(\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\cap E))^{1/1^{*}}}}\ &{}&{\geq\frac{1}{2}(\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\cap E))^{1/1^{*}}}\ &{}&{=\frac{1}{2}\operatorname*{min}\{\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\cap E),\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\setminus E)\}^{1/1^{*}}.}\end{array}
$$
The other case is analogous. 
By applying Poincare's inequality for balls (see the previous exercise), we get that the left-hand side of the previous inequality is bounded from aboveby $c\|D(\chi_{E})\|(B_{R})$ ,andso 
$$
\begin{array}{r l r}&{}&{\frac{1}{2}\operatorname*{min}\{\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\cap E),\mathcal{L}^{N}(B_{R}\setminus E)\}^{1/1^{*}}\leq c\|D(\chi_{E})\|(B_{R})}\ &{}&{\leq c\|D(\chi_{E})\|(\mathbb{R}^{N}).}\end{array}
$$
Hence, the claim is proved. 
Byletting $R\rightarrow\infty$ in the previous inequality and using Proposition B.9, it follows that either $E$ or $\mathbb{R}^{N}\backslash E$ has finite Lebesgue measure. 口 
Thus, we have shown that the Sobolev-Gagliardo-Nirenberg embedding theorem in $B V$ implies the isoperimetric inequality. Next we show that the oppositeis also true. 
Theorem14.45.Assumethattheisoperimetricinequality(14.45)holds forallsetswithfiniteperimeter.Thenthereecistsaconstant $c=c(N)>0$ such that 
$$
\|u\|_{L^{1^{*}}({\mathbb R}^{N})}\leq c\|D u\|({\mathbb R}^{N})
$$
for all $u\in B V(\mathbb{R}^{N})$ 
Proof. Assume first that $u\geq0$ andthat $u\in C^{\infty}(\mathbb{R}^{N})\cap W^{1,1}(\mathbb{R}^{N})$ .For $t\in\mathbb{N}$ ,define $A_{t}:=\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{N}:u(x)>t\}$ .Then by the coarea formula (14.42) and the isoperimetric inequality (14.45), 
$$
\int_{\mathbb{R}^{N}}\left\|\nabla u\right\|d x=\int_{0}^{\infty}\operatorname{P}(A_{t})d t\geq{\frac{1}{c}}\int_{0}^{\infty}({\mathcal{L}}^{N}(A_{t}))^{1/1^{*}}d t.
$$
